column4: Could anyone help me configure my graphics card to work with fglrx? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3106882#post3106882
OK, so you have the fglrx package installed?
Correct ;p
OK... um can you paste it to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
Paste what?
your xorg.conf
Oh I added it to my forum post?
the other one has line numbers though.
then I can tell you what line number to change
Ok one moment please
ok, change line 156 to:       Device   "Generic Video Card"
done
ok so either reset your xserver, or reset the whole computer (might be more reliable, not sure)
ctrl / alt / backspace to reset?
yes, to reset the xserver
oh shit, I just noticed there are two places that had the old one
ah, do you remember the paste url?
Of course :P http://pastebin.com/d62bdedf
and that is your current one, which has no acceleration and uses VESA?
Yep that's the latest,
ok... I think I'll edit it and post a new modification, ok?
sure, thanks a lot btw
also, out of curiosity, what card model is it?
It's a sapphire radeon x1550 pci-e (256mb)
Do you want a link to the forum post again?
no, i've got it
still there?
Yeah, sorry I was reading the forums
ok, I think I haven't missed anything this time...
Ok ;p
were the problems obvious?
I wonder if I can send it to you as a text file...
You can try?
well, it had like 2 of everything, and random garbage I deleted...
I never physically added anything but "disable" under the extensions part with composite since one of the guides said fglrx doesn't support it
oh wait, you just reminded me of something
ok, so you didn't get the xorg.conf file anyways?
I accepted it, but the transfer never started
you can use pastebin if you want, I can just save it myself
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3108368
A guide specifically said turn composite off since fglrx doesn't support it? Section "Extensions"
that's how the config was by default
the composite part sorry *
um.. so you are looking at my modified version?
and then this said disable it, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI
Yeah
yeah, so anyways, backup your old xorg.conf, and try my new one
um, because it doesn't work with composite, so it might not crash as much with this option
that was the default option when I tried with method 1 ;o
yeah, but maybe other things have changed
Alright I won't argue, I don't know anything myself :P
0 means teh same thing as disable
Ok, I'll backup my other one and try this
I'm having issues copying your .conf into place of the other, I tried cp xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf but when I view the file, it's blank
just "sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf" and then paste in the text from the ubuntuforums
Black screen again, I had to revert to my old xorg.conf to boot back in
no error messages?
Nope, it boots up as usual and then just as it would normally reach the login screen a completely black screen
what do you get for businfo with the command: "sudo lshw -class display"
it showed me display 0 and display 1, i'm assuming that's because my video card supports dual display .. anyways i got "bus info: pci@03:00.0"
for both of them?
No, for display 1 it says "bus info: pci@03:00.1"
using feisty?
yep, installed it just yesterday
I made a slight change to the file, if you want to try again... in the Device section, I removed your two options
it should be in the forum: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3108368
Thanks pete, I'm rebooting now
*crosses fingers
Black screen, reverted to my old xorg.conf :p
doh
hm?
maybe try the other pci busid?
isn't that for my 2nd non-existant monitor though?
well, I just thought since the screen was black for this busid, maybe they are reversed.. you know I am just brainstorming at this point
lol oh
I'm going out on a new limb and thinking that's not it, because I tried to enter my password/name at the black screen anyways and i got no sound or anything
Thanks for the effort, I guess I'll sit tight and wait for someone to reply to the forum post. Would you perhaps mind helping me install WINE? ;o
hahahahaaaha
is that a no? ;o lol
nah, wine is one of those things I stay away from... I use all linux software
ok, one last thing... type this, and say the output...:  "/bin/lspci | grep VGA"
Here ;p 03:00.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Unknown device 715f
that's all it says?
Yeah, just that one line
ok then, dead end
lol
did you ever use the firegl-control program?
Nope
heh. You might try it.. in the package fglrx-control ... and the program is run by the command firegl-control
actually, without a hyphen

and one other thing, I put a billion options in the xorg.conf file, which has a remote chance of working (see it at http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3108368 ).. other than that, I have to go, and good luck
AH I viewed that thread :P
ah, ok then goodnight
